title: A LIFE REBORN
passage: 1 Moreover, brethren, I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you, which also you received and in which you stand, 2 by which also you are saved, if you hold fast that word which I preached to you—unless you believed in vain. 3 For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures, 4 and that He was buried, and that He rose again the third day according to the Scriptures.  (1 Corinthians. 15:1-4)
content: Easter is the day when Christians all over the world acknowledge what Jesus did on the Cross. He died to pay the penalty for our sins and reconcile us back to God. He saved us from eternal separation from our Heavenly Father. It is a time of remembrance and reflection on how Jesus changed our lives. Some believers have incredible stories of how Jesus brought them out of sin and brought them into His light. Regardless of how someone came to the knowledge of Christ, the bottom line is that those who have decided to follow Jesus can truly say that it was a journey worth taking. On this day, take time out to reflect on how the Lord Jesus changed your life. Is there evidence that you are transformed by God? Is the Holy Spirit living in you? I believe that every believer has a salvation story of the time when the Holy Spirit first opened their eyes to the truth of the Gospel. What Jesus did on the Cross has so much significance and so much power. There is no one on earth who is exempt from salvation; Jesus died for every single person in this world, regardless of what they have done in the past. Jesus has the power to cleanse us of all unrighteousness, if only we confess our sins to Him and believe in Him. Jesus is standing at the door of our hearts waiting to enter. He wants us to believe in Him, love Him and follow Him with our whole hearts. There is peace and joy in a life lived with Jesus. There is hope and love in a life lived with Jesus. Jesus gives us a purpose and He even wants to use us to reach other people, so they too can experience the redemptive power of God. The road may not be easy all the time, but we know that our lives would not be the same if it had not been for Jesus.
application: Take time out to reflect on when you first accepted Jesus as your Lord and Savior. If you haven’t accepted Him yet, pray the prayer of acceptance now.
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Lord, I thank You for transforming my life. I pray that your light in me will shine for all the world to see.

title: ULTIMATE GRACE
passage: 32 Two other men, both criminals, were also led out with him to be executed. 33 When they came to the place called the Skull, they crucified him there, along with the criminals—one on his right, the other on his left. 34 Jesus said, “Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing.” 46 Jesus called out with a loud voice, “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit.” When he had said this, he breathed his last. (Luke 23:32-34, 46)
content: We hear so many stories of people who commit cruel acts toward other people. There are countless stories of fathers killing their wives, mothers murdering their children and even young people opening fire at schools and churches. Many may remember a particular case where a young man walked into a midweek service at a historic church and shot and killed nine people, including the pastor. Someone looking from the outside would say that this young man deserves the ultimate punishment for killing innocent people, some may even say that he deserves to go to hell. But, one of the witnesses at the church, after hearing of the young man’s conviction, said that she forgave him, and she hopes he finds salvation and forgiveness through Jesus Christ.  Let us remember one true fact: Jesus died for everyone, including that young man. It may be a hard realization, but if that young man were to ask Jesus to forgive him, and decided to follow Jesus today, he would be saved. I have heard stories of people who were devout Muslims but later became saved. There are atheists who have given their lives to Christ. There are even satanists who have been delivered and are now walking with Jesus. The Scripture for today reminds us that those who persecuted and killed Jesus did so out of ignorance. Jesus even prayed that God would forgive them because they did not know the significance of their actions. During this Easter season, we remember that our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, willingly died for all people – even those who persecuted and brutally killed Him. Let us remember that Jesus’ act on the Cross is meant for every person. No one is too far from the grace of God.
application: Just as Jesus extended grace to the criminals on the cross, extend grace to everyone, even when you feel they may not deserve it.
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Lord, Your saving grace still works and the blood that you shed on the Cross still has the power to save. Open the eyes of the lost that they may receive you as their Lord and Savior

title: JESUS ON TRIAL
passage: 59 The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for false evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death. 60 But they did not find any, though many false witnesses came forward. 64 “You have said so,” Jesus replied. “But I say to all of you: From now on you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.” (Matthew 26:59-60, 64)
content: Jesus’ life on earth was free from sin. Jesus was always honest about who He was, and He never denied that He was the Son of God. If Jesus led a sinless life, then how could He have been convicted? What accusation did the Pharisees and the Sanhedrin have against Him? When you read the Gospel accounts, you can see that there was always tension between Jesus and the religion authority. I believe it is safe to say that the Pharisees and the Sanhedrin disliked Jesus, not because He actually did anything wrong, but because He challenged their authority in the presence of the people. When Jesus confronted the religious leaders on their hypocrisy and how they used the Law to oppress the people, the religious leaders were threatened by Jesus’ knowledge and growing popularity. As the tension grew, the religious leaders wanted to find a way to frame Jesus so that they would have a cause to convict Him. Even though the Pharisees and the Sanhedrin tried to wrongfully accuse Jesus, Jesus had a higher calling and His focus was on His mission. He knew that the trials had to take place in order for Him to fulfill what He came to do. Jesus even said to Peter that “do you think I cannot call on my Father, and he will at once put at my disposal more than twelve legions of angels? But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled that said it must happen in this way?” (Matthew 26:53-54). So regardless of the persecution He faced, Jesus always kept His eyes on the prize. Sometimes, life can get burdensome to the point of wanting to give up. We may not face a trial as severe as Jesus did, but in our own lives, we all face something that can sometimes feel out of our ability to handle. We can get overwhelmed with life’s demands and we may not know how certain situations will turn out. There may even be people whom you thought you could trust who speak falsely about you or try to defame your character. But let us use Jesus’ example as a sign of encouragement. He was perfect, yet the religious leaders still found something to accuse him of. Through it all, Jesus never lashed out and He did not lose His focus. Let us always remember to focus on the Lord and know that He will fight our battles
application: Search online for scriptures that help people get through hard times in life. Read and meditate on them
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Lord, help me to keep my eyes focused on you, even when life gets hard.

title: KNOWING GOD
passage: 8 But then, indeed, when you did not know God, you served those which by nature are not gods. 9 But now after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage? (Galatians 4:8-9)
content: We can agree that God knows us, but how does one get to know God? This is something many people have been trying to understand for thousands of years. Has anybody ever seen God? Is it possible to really know Him? The Bible says in John 1:18 that, “No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made Him known.” (NIV). Jesus Christ is our connection to the Father. The only way to truly know God is to know Christ. Jesus Christ is the one who holds the key. The life of Jesus is no secret, the world knows of His teachings, but the most important thing to know is His death and resurrection. Understanding what took place on the Cross is essential to knowing the character of God. On the Cross, Christ endured the punishment that we deserved. God cared for us so much that He didn’t have to think twice about sacrificing Jesus Christ. On the cross is also where God shows us that He wants us to accept Jesus, because that is the only way into heaven. What was done on the Cross is also a display of the miraculous power of God, the power of resurrection, which is within us. Once we have come to know God, we should not move away from Him. We are no longer slaves to the world and cannot afford to be trapped by the enemy. That same resurrection power is alive today. James 4:7 says, “Therefore submit to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you.” The devil has no choice and has already been defeated. Once we know the goodness of God, there is no reason to be anywhere else.
application: As you get to know Christ more, don’t keep Him to yourself, share your knowledge of Him with others.
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Oh Lord, reveal Yourself to me like never before. Strengthen me to continuously resist the enemy.

title: JESUS, OUR REDEEMER
passage: 59 Then after about an hour had passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Surely this fellow also was with Him, for he is a Galilean.” 60 But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying!” Immediately, while he was still speaking, the rooster crowed. 61 And the Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said to him, “Before the rooster crows, you will deny Me three times.” 62 So Peter went out and wept bitterly. (Luke 22: 59-62)
content: Of the twelve disciples, Peter can be described as the disciple who was impulsive, strong-willed and enthusiastic. Anyone who reads about Peter in the Bible would say that he had a strong personality that showed through his encounters with Jesus. But Peter also had some character flaws as well and he sometimes bit off more than he could chew. For example, when Jesus talked about how He was going to die, Peter was the one who was bold enough to rebuke Jesus for talking about death. However, Jesus had to correct him (Matthew 16:22-23). After the transfiguration of Jesus on the mount, Peter impulsively suggested that three tabernacles be erected to honor Jesus, Moses, and Elijah, but Jesus had to correct him again (Matthew 17:4). One of the most significant acts was when Peter boasted about never forsaking Jesus, but Peter denied Jesus three times soon after his proclamation of faithfulness (Matthew 26:33, 70-74). Regardless of Peter’s decisions, Jesus still decided to use him to establish the Church. Sometimes, we may think that we have to be a complete package before God can use us, but God may have to prune us before we can be used. In John 15, the Bible says that every branch that bears fruit will be pruned so that it can be more fruitful. Even when you mess up, remember that God has a plan for you. Jesus didn’t give up on Peter because he failed; however, Jesus was patient with Peter and lovingly restored Peter to service. God needed to shape and mold Peter into the man God wanted him to be, in order to establish the church. Peter was not a likely candidate nor was he perfect, but God saw potential and thus pruned Peter into a man of God. Sometimes, we can beat ourselves up when we mess up, but if you run back to the Father, He will take you in. Don’t give in to the devil’s lies that Jesus can’t forgive you or you’re too messed up that Jesus can’t help you. If you find yourself in a situation where you have sinned against God, ask Him for forgiveness and run to Him so that He can develop you into the man or woman He wants you to be.
application: Run to Jesus any time you fall, He will surely take you back.
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Lord, shape me and mold me into the person you want me to be.

title: GOD, OUR DELIVERER
passage: We are hard-pressed on every side, yet not crushed; we are perplexed, but not in despair; 9 persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed. (2 Corinthians 4:8-9)
content:
People all over this world are in search of a hope. We often read about one catastrophe after another and it’s as if we are almost numb to it. On one day, we might read a report about a terrorist attack by Islamic extremists, then the next day, it could be a random mass shooting in a public place. 
Regardless of the things happening in the world, we can still have hope – a hope that is new every morning, regardless of what event took place the night before. Christ truly is the solution to all the problems going on around us. If we ever find ourselves to be involved in a bad situation, Christ is the one who can bring us out of it by applying the Bible to that situation. Christ can also give us the protection we need in these situations. I’ve heard of devastating tornados tearing through whole neighborhoods, destroying everything in its path, but yet people are able to survive. When Christ is a part of our lives, many times, we come out of situations that seem utterly hopeless. 
Acts 14:19-20 tells us, “Then Jews from Antioch and Iconium came there; and having persuaded the multitudes, they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city, supposing him to be dead. However, when the disciples gathered around him, he rose up and went into the city. And the next day he departed with Barnabas to Derbe.” This Scripture is a perfect example of what Paul knew about his life. How is it that a man can be stoned and get up from such a horrible situation? It was the hope of his calling, it was God who delivered him and gave him the strength to carry on. Paul went through many difficulties during his life as a missionary, but he was not hopeless – he knew God would not forsake him. We must trust God to be our deliverer, the same way Paul did
application: Put all hope in the Lord, knowing that He is the one who will always have your back.
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Lord, teach me how to trust you continuously, even during difficult times.

title: A FORGIVING HEART
passage: 13 And do not lead us into temptation, But deliver us from the evil one. For Yours is the kingdom and the power and the glory forever. Amen.14 “For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you. 15 But if you do not forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses. (Matthew 6:13-15)
content: We have all been hurt by someone else at some point in our lives. What makes that pain even worse is when the perpetrator is a close friend or family member. When this happens, many times we react without even thinking about what we are doing. Following our natural instincts, we retaliate in a way that might not be Christ-like. Instead of responding with bitterness or anger, we need to slow down or maybe even remove ourselves from the situation. Whether the other person hurt you intentionally or not shouldn’t even matter. What matters is how you respond. If the other person does not know they offended you, they would not know to apologize. The Bible gives us many examples of how one can show forgiveness. The prophet Hosea, who was told to marry an adulterous woman, had to be a man of forgiveness. In those times, Hosea’s wife could have been put to death for her sin. What would have happened if Hosea was living today? Many would have told him to divorce his wife, and according to Matthew 19, he wouldn’t have been wrong in doing so. However, look at what Paul wrote in Colossians 3:12-13. “Therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, put on tender mercies, kindness, humility, meekness, longsuffering, bearing with one another, and forgiving one another, if anyone has a complaint against another; even as Christ forgave you, so you also must do.” When someone does us wrong, we should not be quick to respond in an ungodly way. Think about all the times we have offended God and how He continues to respond to us in His mercy. The sacrifices we make in our lives are extremely minute in comparison to what the Lord has done for us.
application: Demonstrate what it means to be forgiving. Ask for forgiveness when necessary and forgive others.
memory-verse: But He was wounded for our transgressions, He was bruised for our iniquities; the chastisement for our peace was upon Him, and by His stripes we are healed. (Isaiah 53:5)
prayer: Father, thank you for your forgiveness. Mold me to be like Christ, to be one with a forgiving heart.

title: THE LORD’S BATTLE
passage: And he said, "Listen, all you of Judah and you inhabitants of Jerusalem, and you, King Jehoshaphat! Thus says the LORD to you: 'Do not be afraid nor dismayed because of this great multitude, for the battle is not yours, but God's ... You will not need to fight in this battle. Position yourselves, stand still and see the salvation of the LORD, who is with you, O Judah and Jerusalem!' Do not fear or be dismayed;   (2 Chronicles 20: 15-17)
content: This scripture is an assurance you can hold onto when going through difficult circumstances that seem out of your control and overwhelming. There are some battles that you simply can't win alone or with your own strength. At times, the Lord tells you to take your stance in Him, be still and see His deliverance manifest. Most times, you need to take your hands off, stand back and let God fight for you. You need not fear what comes against you. Stand firm in your faith. God is aware of your situation. Though you may feel overcome when you look at your condition, the Lord sees the whole picture and sees your way of escape. You need to let God take control and fight the battle you are facing. He has promised that He is with you and will bring you through. If you are facing a battle today that seems prodigious, hand it over to God and let Him fight for you. He will work it all out, and make a way where there seems to be no way.
application: As a child of God, the benefit of sonship is yours. All the promises applicable to a child of God apply to you in your circumstances.  Keep this in mind in order to reinforce the feeling of reassurance knowing that God will fight for His own.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: Lord, I thank you from the bottom of my heart for keeping your promise to fight my battles. Allow me to continue to feel your presence always.

title: WHAT ABOUT TOMORROW?
passage: 31 So do not worry, saying, ‘What shall we eat?’ or ‘What shall we drink?’ or ‘What shall we wear?’ 32 For the pagans run after all these things, and your heavenly Father knows that you need them. 33 But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well. 34 Therefore do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own. (Matthew 6:31-34)
content: Life happenings may bring anxiety but worrying only amplifies issues. Worry can usher us into a state where we cannot think clearly or sensibly about a situation. In those instances, prayer and working out a solution can’t possibly be effective if we are caught up in 'worry'. What of tomorrow? Tomorrow hasn't arrived; today is what we need to concern ourselves with. Don’t get anxious about things that may or may not happen. Give it over to God in prayer. You can find God's peace in your place of worry. Don't let worry take root, for it is all consuming. Also, it doesn’t ease the apprehension of the unknown. Faith and worry cannot manifest at once. With the Lord, you must choose one over other. Take your eyes off the 'what ifs' and place them on Jesus. The situation’s severity doesn’t matter to the Lord. You can always walk through it with your eyes on Jesus. Living with worry of tomorrow is not your portion. Leave it to Him to provide a guarantee of a wonderful tomorrow.
application: I will let God take care of tomorrow. Allow Him to do so.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: Lord, I cast my worries of tomorrow on you because in you, I am assured a good ending.

title: TOWARD COMPLETION
passage: 3 I thank my God every time I remember you. 4 In all my prayers for all of you, I always pray with joy 5 because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now, 6 being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus. (Philippians 1:6)
content: God continues to work in us, developing, improving and bringing to full perfection, the work He has begun. The work of sanctification begins the moment we receive Him into our hearts. He works on our carnal attitudes, beliefs, fears, pride, and our human nature in an all-encompassing way. He also plants godly seed that produces a spirit-filled nature. He cultivates this nature, watering and nurturing the seeds so they will sprout and bring forth the 'Fruit of the Spirit', as the Gardener described in John 15. He also helps us to grow in the gifts and talents He has placed within us and further develops them for the kingdom. Until we meet with Him in paradise, this work will continue in us. If you feel that God is not doing anything in your life right now – you are wrong. Remember, He who began a good work in you will continue until the day of Christ Jesus. He doesn’t begin anything He can’t accomplish. Don't give up - He doesn’t! What He began, He will finish.
application: I will believe in myself because the King of the Universe believes in me.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: Lord, you have started a good thing in me, and I know you are more than able to perfect it in Jesus name.  For this, I am thankful.

title: FOCUSED ON ETERNITY
passage: "...If then you have been raised with Christ [to a new life, thus sharing His resurrection from the dead], aim at and seek the [rich, eternal treasures] that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. And set your minds and keep them set on what is above (the higher things), not on the things that are on the earth. For [as far as this world is concerned] you have died, and your [new, real] life is hidden with Christ in God..." (Colossians 3: 1-3)
content: "Set your minds and keep them set on what is above." As humans, we tend to lose focus. Some of us are deceived and wrapped up in concerns of this world. We ponder more on our acquisitions, life insurance, student loans, food, clothing and shelter more than the Kingdom of Heaven. As followers of Christ, we are made aware that our lives on Earth will determine our place in eternity. How we live and earthly concerns that consume us will determine our final dwelling place. Satan tends to deceive us, even believers, into thinking that there is time on earth to go here and there. Tomorrow is not promised. The time to do right is today so that our eternal security isn’t shaken.  We should be focused on and tend to things of eternal value always. Nothing else matters. We can't take anything we have accumulated here with us. Chasing things of earthly value and importance robs us of what really matters. We will remain discontented with worldly acquisitions only because they will never satisfy. Only things of eternal value will ever satisfy. Pursue the riches of heaven today and find satisfaction in knowing that you will be on the right side of eternity.
application: Spend every day with the Kingdom of Heaven in mind.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: I want to be with you, Lord, forever. Help me to keep eternity first and foremost on my mind.

title: NO WEAPON CAN PROSPER
passage: "...But no weapon that is formed against you shall prosper, and every tongue that shall rise against you in judgment you shall show to be in the wrong. This [peace, righteousness, security, triumph over opposition] is the heritage of the servants of the Lord [those in whom the ideal Servant of the Lord is reproduced]; this is the righteousness or the vindication which they obtain from Me [this is that which I impart to them as their justification], says the Lord..." (Isaiah 54: 17)
content: This is another wonderful and sweet promise of God. As we walk in God's righteousness, no weapon fashioned against us will prosper. Nothing that is said against us negatively will carry weight. It will be proven false in the end. The truth will always prevail. Sometimes, people gossip and say false things about us to ruin our reputation. Satan sometimes tries this tactic. He tries his best to weigh us down with lies and deceitful thoughts in order to make us feel as if God will not prevail or His hand is not strong enough to protect us. We can take heart and ignore those fallacies. For we know the truth about God that if we walk uprightly before him with clear consciences, He will vindicate us. Know that no weapon fashioned against you will prosper. The truth of all that God says about you will prevail in Jesus name.
application: Take God at His word and know that no weapon of the enemy fashioned against you will prosper.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: Lord, destroy every weapon formed against me to harm me and condemn every tongue that rise against me.

title: PRIDE GOES BEFORE A FALL
passage: "...Humble yourselves [feeling very insignificant] in the presence of the Lord, and He will exalt you [He will lift you up and make your lives significant]..." (James 4:10)
content: God will never resist the humble. He exalts those who are humble themselves. When you acknowledge His might and sovereignty, you are humbling yourself before Him. The ‘feeling of insignificance' that we feel sometimes showcases God's awesomeness. It doesn’t mean that we should feel unworthy to approach God. Our humility is putting into action the idea that God is greater than us. We cannot stand before His perfection and holiness. All our good works are worth nothing in comparison to His faithfulness to us.  As we humble ourselves before Him, He will lift us up and make our lives substantial. God can't do much through us if we are haughty. If we think too highly of ourselves and abilities, we won't feel the need to rely on God. A humble person knows they need God's help and gives all the credit to Him. A proud person thinks they achieved everything in their own strength. Cast off the haughty attitude today and exalt the Lord with humble gratitude.
application: Remain humble in your thoughts and actions, and let God exalt you.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: Lord, help me to remain humble before you so that you can use me mightily. I ask for more of you and less of me in Jesus name.

title: WORLDLY NONSENSE
passage: "...O Timothy, guard and keep the deposit entrusted [to you]! Turn away from the irreverent babble and godless chatter, with the vain and empty and worldly phrases, and the subtleties and the contradictions in what is falsely called knowledge and spiritual illumination. [For] by making such profession some have erred (missed the mark) as regards the faith. Grace (divine favor and blessing) be with you all! Amen (so be it)..."  (1Timothy 6: 20-21)
content: As Christians, we need to proceed with caution when it comes to how we speak, the things we listen to and things that occupy our time. Is it just 'irreverent babble' and 'godless chatter' that fill our time? Or is it just worldly notions disguised as knowledge and spiritual illumination? It's so easy to get caught up in the speech and mindset of the world around us. The empty philosophies and high-sounding nonsense presented by equally deceived individuals will do nothing more than waste your time.  They provide nothing of lasting value. Most times when we replace godly for worldly wisdom, we end up off track.  In this day and age, we need to be on guard knowing that worldly notions and ways can hinder God’s amazing grace.
application: I will be diligent in where my thoughts drift and the chatter I entertain. I will understand that things of the kingdom matter above all.
memory-verse: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God unto salvation to everyone that believeth: to the Jew first and also to the Greek. (Romans 1:16)
prayer: Lord, keep me from entertaining worthless chatter and worldly nonsense.  Help me to keep my focus on you.

title: CEASELESS PRAISE
passage: 1I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth.2 My soul shall make its boast in the Lord;The humble shall hear of it and be glad.3 Oh, magnify the Lord with me,And let us exalt His name together. (Psalms 34:1-3)
content:
Humanly speaking, it is most difficult to praise God in the time of trials; yet, I have never seen the most rewarding, stress-eliminating weapon as praising God during your trials. The psalmist said, “I will bless the Lord at all times.” 
When you are in a bad situation or trial, your sadness will not resolve the problem. It will only keep you stressed out and make you sick. I have heard people say they are angry with God and refuse to come to church. The truth is that innumerable numbers of people are serving God and your unwillingness to serve Him does not reduce His power and ability to perform miracle in other people’s lives. Some take their pain out on the church and that is wrong because everyone (both the Pastor and the members) in the church depend on God. If God does not help you, no one can. Always know that if anyone helps you, it is because God led them to do it. So rejoice in the Lord.
David wrote the Psalm in the chapter today after the Lord saved him from a diehard situation where he had to pretend like a crazy man in the presence of a king. He was not smiling or happy when he wrote it. Even though, it was not a joyous moment, David chose to praise the Lord.
application: When I am faced with a difficult and trying situation, first, I will remind myself that if God does not help me, no one can. Secondly, I choose to praise God despite all.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: Lord, I thank you because you are always faithful. I pray for the grace to always rejoice in all situations in Jesus name.

title: TASTY GOODNESS
passage: 8Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good; Blessed is the man who trusts in Him! 9 Oh, fear the Lord, you His saints!There is no want to those who fear Him.10 The young lions lack and suffer hunger;But those who seek the Lord shall not lack any good thing. (Psalms 34:8-10)
content:
If you are one who enjoys watching cooking shows, you likely may have noticed that professional chefs have the tendency to adjust the ingredients they use in their recipe until they achieve the desired taste for the dish. Chefs will often be seen tasting and adding more or less of an ingredient as they are cooking. These chefs do not give up until they have reached their desired outcome. 
Reading these Bible verses reminded me of one of the chefs who kept adding ingredients and tasting to see that the desired result was achieved. The first ingredient you need to add to make you get the desired taste of the goodness of the Lord is trust. The psalmist said “Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good; blessed is the man who trusts in Him!” The second ingredient is the fear of the Lord. The psalmist said, “Oh, fear the Lord, you His saints! There is no want to those who fear Him.” I believe this is not a phobic fear of God but a reverential fear. 
When you begin to revere and honor God, He becomes the only source of hope and solution to your problems. Just like the chef relied on ingredients to make the food taste better, reliance on God is needed to achieve your expectations in life. As you keep adding more ingredients to food to get the right results, you can also add more of God into your life and situations. He is beautiful for all situations and is the joy of the whole world. Just keep trusting and having faith in Him. You will find out that the Lord is good and is a rewarder of those who diligently seek him.
application: I will not stop trusting and being faithful in my walk with the Lord. He is more faithful and will never forget my service of love and endurance.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: Lord Jesus, I thank you because you are faithful and will answer my prayers. Give me the strength to keep trusting in you and never stop walking in Your fear.

title: BATTLE TRAINER
passage: 1Blessed be the Lord my Rock, Who trains my hands for war,And my fingers for battle 2 My lovingkindness and my fortress,My high tower and my deliverer,My shield and the One in whom I take refuge,Who subdues my people under me. (Psalms 144:1-2)
content:
Your perspective and outlook on trials is very important to your victory. Sometimes, people get bitter or self-righteous because of their challenges. I was talking to a mother some time ago who was bitter about her husband. She blamed everything negative going on in her family on God and her husband. Every effort to reason with her that God is faithful, and her husband is not her enemy, was futile. She believed that the negligence of her husband caused all her trials and was frustrated that God was taking His time to help her. Her dependence was not in God and invariably, she never allowed Him to teach her hand to war.
 
The devil is your ultimate enemy. He may use a man, invade your body with sickness, instigate quarrel between you, your spouse or your loved ones especially your brother or sister in the church. It is therefore very important that you acknowledge the real enemy and rely on the wisdom, knowledge, power, and presence of God to help you to conquer the enemy.
 
When you take refuge in God, He will not only teach you how to fight the battle, but He will tell you the weapon to use. Each battle you face needs a different weapon to fight it. God knows and has all the weapons
application: When life’s trouble crushes me, I will not quickly shift blame or condemn myself. First, I will acknowledge the supremacy of God in every situation.  Secondly, I will acknowledge His love, care, and mercy on me.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: Father in Jesus Name, I thank you for your presence in my life and every situation. I know you are faithful and I totally depend on You. Please help me in Jesus name.

title: RECALL PAST VICTORIES
passage: 20 Go forth from Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans! With a voice of singing, Declare, proclaim this, Utter it to the end of the earth; Say, “The Lord has redeemed His servant Jacob!”21 And they did not thirst When He led them through the deserts; He caused the waters to flow from the rock for them; He also split the rock, and the waters gushed out. (Isaiah 48:20-21)
content:
It’s a season of reflection for my church. We are reflecting on God’s goodness for 25 years. God had been faithful and made it easy on us in our moments of reflections because He started doing greater miracles this year than ever before. To commemorate this season of celebration, women that were trusting God for children in our church were having their babies. I believe that there are more testimonies lurking around the corner for those who are still trusting God for their own miracle of children and before the end of this year, they will cry for joy in Jesus name - Amen!
During one of the thanksgiving celebrations, there was such an unspeakable joy in the church that the reassuring presence of God permeated the atmosphere. I remembered exactly 20 years ago when we had our church celebration with the theme “I will do a new thing.” The presence and joy of the Lord was also noticeable in our midst. The evidence of His glory was manifested when God provided a new location to build His church. On the week of the celebration, an invited guest heard about our quest to purchase a land, and through divine connection and God’s provision assisted us in purchasing the land. God perfected the purchase by making sure that the real estate size and price was too good to be true. God will perform “too good to be true” miracles in your lives in Jesus name. Your expectation will not be cut short! 
Looking back on the past victories, I can truly say that for the last 25 years (since the foundation of the church), the goodness of God has not ceased and His kindness is forever more.
application: Anytime I feel like losing hope and giving up on God, I will reflect back on His goodness and mercy that kept me alive. This will renew my hope for a better and greater tomorrow.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: Father in Jesus Name, I thank you that you have started a good work in me. Please perfect it to the end in Jesus Name.

title: MIGHTY WARRIOR
passage: 46 The Lord lives! Blessed be my Rock! Let the God of my salvation be exalted.47 It is God who avenges me, And subdues the peoples under me; 48 He delivers me from my enemies.You also lift me up above those who rise against me; You have delivered me from the violent man.49 Therefore I will give thanks to You, O Lord, among the Gentiles, And sing praises to Your name. 50 Great deliverance He gives to His king, And shows mercy to His anointed, To David and his descendants forevermore. (Psalms 18:46-50)
content:
An elderly woman once spoke to me about her properties that her family members were fighting to take over. Due to her limited mobility, they divided some of the lands amongst themselves and were bold enough to try to evict her from her current living quarters. She could trust anyone including her children who were also fighting over her properties. 
Not quite long ago, God fought her battle for her. A litigating company told one of the children trying to evict her that he would need her consent to do so. He was put to shame and his pride was shattered. This child, her biological child, used to come to the house to brag about evicting her. She kept praying and would go to every prayer meeting at the church. She once told me that she was tempted to seek voodoo men because she felt like cursing her own children for turning against her. Instead, she stuck to her faith and God delivered her and restored what was hers back to her. 
As this passage so rightly says, the Lord God is our deliverer and He delivers us from the hands of our enemies. This woman knew that her battle was not only one to be fought in the physical; she also sought the hand of God through prayer and reliance on her Heavenly Father. Whenever you are faced with the fiery darts of the enemy (whatever form it may come in), remember that God is the mighty Warrior who is on your side.
application: During my battle, I will know the real enemy that I’m fighting and the weapon of warfare. I will fight the devil, my adversary, by forgiving those that offend me. Secondly, I will pray in the Name of Jesus, casting down evil imagination, pulling down strongholds, and everything against the Will of God for me.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: Lord, you are my strength. I know you have never lost any battle. In Jesus Name, I pull down every stronghold and powers militating against me.

title: DELAY SEEMS FOREVER
passage: 1I waited patiently for the Lord; And He inclined to me, And heard my cry.2 He also brought me up out of a horrible pit, Out of the miry clay, And set my feet upon a rock, And established my steps.3 He has put a new song in my mouth—Praise to our God; Many will see it and fear, And will trust in the Lord. 4 Blessed is that man who makes the Lord his trust, And does not respect the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.5 Many, O Lord my God, are Your wonderful works Which You have done And Your thoughts toward usCannot be recounted to You in order; If I would declare and speak of them, They are more than can be numbered. (Psalms 40:1-5)
content:
Your trials are not designed to define your future. God does not intend for the consequences of your mistakes to define the destiny He has prepared for you. Your trials, errors or mistakes should draw you closer to God and not away from Him. God is waiting for you to come, confess your sins and repent of them. He wants to restore you and establish your steps.
Though in Psalm 40, we never knew why David praised the Lord or about the horrible pit he found himself. All we know is that he was in great displeasure that he described the situation as a miry clay. It must have been a situation that David thought that he would never overcome. He obviously felt the pain and darkness of the pit. This reminds me of Jesus’ pain on the Cross. Though He went through an hour of darkness when He could have summoned His angels to cause destruction on the earth; He waited on the Cross patiently for the Lord to perfect all that He had purposed for Him (Jesus).
When you find yourself in a terrible pit dug by a family member, you may need to wait patiently for God’s help. If you try to rescue yourself, you may find yourself severing ties before the due time of rescue. I don’t believe that anyone enjoys trials or waiting “patiently” for an unseen God but you build Godly character in your trials.
application: I will reflect on the goodness and faithfulness of God in the past when I’m waiting. I will wait without murmuring. I will wait in praise and see God setting my feet upon the Rock that is Him.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: O Lord in the Name of Jesus, hold my hands and pull me out of my miry clay; establish my feet to stay.

title: CORPORATE PRAISE
passage: 1Oh come, let us sing to the Lord! Let us shout joyfully to the Rock of our salvation.2 Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving; Let us shout joyfully to Him with psalms.3 For the Lord is the great God, And the great King above all gods.4 In His hand are the deep places of the earth; The heights of the hills are His also.5 The sea is His, for He made it; And His hands formed the dry land. 6 Oh come, let us worship and bow down; Let us kneel before the Lord our Maker. (Psalms 95:1-6)
content: It is easier to praise God in a large multitude than alone. Many people say it is difficult to pray during times of trials. It is easier to stay home and away from others. In other words, they want to be left alone. This does not eliminate a bad mood. It is better to act opposite to the way you feel when depressed especially when it comes to fellowshipping together with others. The Bible tells us “not to forsake the assembling of ourselves together, as is the manner of some, but to exhort one another, as you see the Day approaching.” (Hebrews 10:25) It is also important to know that sometimes the devil orchestrate situations that causes stress which can lead to depression and feelings of isolation. Because the devil knows the great things that God wants to do in your life, He may try to abort them before they manifest. You need to be aware of his scheme! Sometimes, the devil brings unnecessary issues and may even inflate their magnitude. If you give the issue your attention, he would have succeeded in distracting you. Most times, he may use people close to you to achieve his aims.  Again, beware of his scheme. Don’t stay away from fellowship. Remember, “be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil walks about like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour.” (1 Peter 5:8)
application: Remind yourself of the importance of corporate fellowship. Even when you lack the desire to be amongst other people, encourage yourself to be in the midst of a supportive, Christian fellowship.
memory-verse: I will bless the Lord at all times; His praise shall continually be in my mouth. (Psalms 34:1)
prayer: Father in Jesus Name, I seek you alone at all times. My heart and mind seek after you; help me to never forsake the assembly of others.

title: THE FINAL AUTHORITY
passage: 8 “Remember this, and show yourselves men;Recall to mind, O you transgressors.9 Remember the former things of old,For I am God, and there is no other;I am God, and there is none like Me,10 Declaring the end from the beginning,And from ancient times things that are not yet done,Saying, ‘My counsel shall stand,And I will do all My pleasure,’11 Calling a bird of prey from the east,The man who executes My counsel, from a far country.Indeed I have spoken it;I will also bring it to pass.I have purposed it;I will also do it. 12 “Listen to Me, you stubborn-hearted, Who are far from righteousness:13 I bring My righteousness near, it shall not be far off;My salvation shall not linger.And I will place salvation in Zion,For Israel My glory. (Isaiah 46:8-13)
content: I love this simple fact about God. He will do what He promised to do for you. He is the one that created you in the first place. He knew the day you will be conceived in your mother’s womb, the date of your birth and ultimately, decided your family. He knows about the kind of life experience that will come your way while growing up, both bad or good, and He has given you power over them all. I have come to respect Joyce Meyer so much. Not only did she survive abuse and molestation by her father, she was willing to obey God’s instruction when He told her to forgive her father. She forgave him and took care of him and his wife, her biological mother. This is beyond what a human being will ordinarily do. It takes the special grace and ability of God to forgive such parents. The depraved mind of her father led him to molest her, take away her innocence, and ability to experience childhood normally. She lost her innocence. The only sense one can make from this is that God knew about it all. He knew what He wanted to do with and through Joyce Meyer. He knew that thousands of women would have similar experiences and that Joyce Meyer would be the one He would use for the abused women. God also gave her a husband that would assist her in fulfilling her destiny. With God, her destiny was not wasted.
application: When I am being treated unfairly and don’t feel like forgiving, I will pray for strength from the Holy Spirit to direct me to the path of healing.
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you!I have made, and I will bear;Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: O Lord, I cannot do this by myself. Help me Holy Spirit in Jesus Name.

title: RICHES IN CHRIST
passage: 26 For you are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus. 27 For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ. 28 There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free, there is neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus. 29 And if you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise. (Galatians 3:26-29)
content:
The children of the Queen of England are rich and have an inheritance passed down to them by their parents. Every child that comes from the loins of the Queen’s children are entitled to the wealth of the Queen. Our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ, is the Lord over all things and every realm. He rules and reign in the kingdom and affairs of men. He does not rule over England alone but He rules over the universe. He is the King of all kings and Lord of all lords. 
Your inheritance and riches in Christ Jesus is unlimited. It is not limited to the geographical area in which you are living, but it cuts across borders and spreads everywhere the sole of your feet touches. What an amazing and unending inheritance we have in Christ Jesus. The most enjoyable part is that your inheritance does not end here on earth alone but it continues to eternity. It is important to note that the privilege of obtaining this inheritance is extended to family members only. It can be passed down and shared with family members who have confessed Jesus Christ as their Lord and Savior. Therefore, if you are yet to become a member of the family of Christ then you simply have to declare your willingness by confessing Jesus as your Lord and Savior. Then, you can enjoy the family’s untold wealth
application: I will remain in the family and get continually plugged into the blessings of the family. I will not allow anything or anyone to unplug me from the family.
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: Lord Jesus, you are my Lord and Savior. I key into Your inheritance from today onwards and declare that Abraham's blessings are mine.

title: CONFIDENCE IN CHRIST
passage: 12 Beware, brethren, lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief in departing from the living God; 13 but exhort one another daily, while it is called “Today,” lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin. 14 For we have become partakers of Christ if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast to the end, 15 while it is said: “Today, if you will hear His voice, Do not harden your hearts as in the rebellion.” (Hebrews 3:12-15)
content: When observing little kids who play sports in school, one will notice that they play with vigor. The moment they find out that one of their parents is watching, especially their mother, they want to show off so that they can get a loud cheer from their mother. Mothers are usually loud cheerleaders who make sure that they call the name of their child as they cheer on. It was a tough one when we were trying to build our church without sufficient financial resources. The contractors were demanding for money, the congregation had expectation of completion in two weeks and it looked as though it would not come to pass. When a friend with experience in building construction visited two weeks before the opening day, he made it seem impossible to complete the project within the time frame. We had just installed the insulation and were yet to put the drywall, ceiling, painting, and carpeting, just to name a few. However, our confidence was in God who told us that no matter our experience, we must not stop the construction. We harkened to His words and believed in Him. His words built our faith and kept us going. Lo and behold, we saw the realization of His promises. Know that God the Father is watching over you and cheering you on when you are doing His will. When you are doing all that He designed for your life, you will get the confidence to move on no matter the opposition.
application: Whether things are going well or not, put your trust and confidence in Christ Jesus and allow Him to see you through.
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: Father in Jesus Name, give me the confidence to remain steadfast and full of faith in You.

title: DESIGNER ORIGINAL
passage: 4 Then the word of the LORD came to me, saying: 5 “Before I formed you in the womb I knew you; before you were born I sanctified you; I ordained you a prophet to the nations.” 6 Then said I: “Ah, Lord GOD! Behold, I cannot speak, for I am a youth.” 7 But the LORD said to me: “Do not say, ‘I am a youth,’ For you shall go to all to whom I send you, And whatever I command you, you shall speak. 8 Do not be afraid of their faces, For I am with you to deliver you,” says the LORD. (Jeremiah 1:4-8)
content: Sometimes, when I look at Melania Trump, I marvel at the things God can do with the life of ordinary people. Melania is the First Lady of the United States and wife of the 45th president of the United States of America, President Donald Trump. Melania was not born in America. She was born in Novo Mesto, Slovenia and grew up in Sevnica. She joined the modeling world at the age of 16. She quit school to pursue her career. She worked as a fashion model for agencies in Milan and Paris, later, moving to New York City in 1996. Melania married Donald Trump in January 2005. She became a citizen of the United States of America in 2006. Within ten years of relocating to the United States, she met with destiny that will change the trajectory of her life. Though, she had a catalog of achievements between the age of 16 when she left home to meeting President Trump, however, nothing can be compared to the day the President was sworn in, and she was recognized as the First Lady of the United States of America. I guess what amazes me most is the fact that while she was still in her mother’s womb, the hand of the Lord was fashioning her to become a First Lady of America. Those who were sitting with her in the classroom in Slovenia, never knew that they were sitting in the class with a future First Lady of the United States of America. While she left school and was wandering all over the world modeling, she and everyone around her, never knew she was a future First Lady. Let me point out two important facts to you. First, God knew who He has created you to be and you cannot alter it. Sometimes the choices you make may delay it, but they cannot change God’s plan for you. Secondly, God is the maker of all things and does not take advice from any man to make you who He wants you to be.
application: I will not be afraid of what man can do to me. The Creator of all things is Jehovah God. I will keep myself in alignment with God always.
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: Father in Jesus Name, help me O Lord to completely walk in your Will for me. When I am out of alignment; gently nudge me back to your purpose for me in Jesus Name.

title: EXISTENCE BEFORE TIME BEGAN
passage: 22 “The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His way,Before His works of old.23 I have been established from everlasting,From the beginning, before there was ever an earth.24 When there were no depths I was brought forth,When there were no fountains abounding with water.25 Before the mountains were settled,Before the hills, I was brought forth;26 While as yet He had not made the earth or the fields,Or the primal dust of the world.27 When He prepared the heavens, I was there,When He drew a circle on the face of the deep,28 When He established the clouds above,When He strengthened the fountains of the deep,29 When He assigned to the sea its limit,So that the waters would not transgress His command,When He marked out the foundations of the earth, (Proverbs 8:22-29)
content:
My grandfather was a Muslim and would always try to convince my father who gave his life to Christ that they were serving the same God. In other words, he was claiming that Christians and Muslims have the same God as their father, though; he does not believe Jesus is the Son of God or God the Son. There is a stark difference between Christianity (our relationship with Christ) and other religions. The most distinct is the preexistence of Jesus Christ before the world began. So, it is an error to equate our Lord, Jesus Christ, to other gods. It is a total misconception of Salvation in the Lord Jesus Christ when anyone compares Christianity with other religions. Some will even dare to say that we are serving the same God. The god they are serving has a beginning and an end but the Bible text we read today tells us that Jesus Christ has been in existence since the beginning even before creation.
 Jesus Christ cannot be refuted; He cannot be compared to anyone. He knows all things and can do all things. He knows those who will serve Him and those who will serve other gods, no matter the persuasion to come to Him (Jesus Christ). Look at it this way. Jesus knew that Judas was going to betray Him. He did everything right and expressed relentless love that should have changed the mind of Judas but unfortunately, Judas chose to serve and obey the enemy.
application: will not be compelled to accept other religions as Christianity. Unashamedly, I confess Jesus Christ as Lord over all other gods.
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: O Lord, give me the grace to confess you as Lord and Savior anywhere I find myself in Jesus Name.

title: ANYONE CAN HAVE HIM
passage: 15 And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them, as upon us at the beginning. 16 Then I remembered the word of the Lord, how He said, ‘John indeed baptized with water, but you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’ 17 If therefore God gave them the same gift as He gave us when we believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I that I could withstand God?” (Acts 11:15-17)
content: The Holy Spirit is never prejudiced. He comes into the life of anyone that desires Him. Over the years I have seen little kids, teenagers, as well as adults receive the Holy Spirit and His gifts as long as they open their hearts to Him. Cornelius was an unbeliever who did good works. He knew how to please God though he knew little about Him. He was not privy to the law nor did he know about the visitation of the Holy Spirit, yet he prayed with his household daily and gave alms. God recognized his good works and rewarded him; not in the kind of works that he did but with the Holy Spirit. God rewarded Cornelius with the baptism, infilling and gift of the Holy Spirit. When Cornelius knew that Peter was coming, he went and invited everyone he knew including his servants. While listening to Peter preach the Gospel, the Holy Spirit not only visited his household but everyone present which included family, friends, and even his servants.   Today, the Holy Spirit will fill your heart and the hearts of anyone in your household who opens their hearts to Him. A lot of people leave their house maids at home and go to church. That is a rip-off to you and your family because a house maid filled with the Holy Spirit is a house maid that will work for you as if they are working for the Lord.
application: Share the importance of the presence of the Holy Spirit with your friends and family members.
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: Lord, I thank You for the gift of the Holy Spirit. I give my family to You. Fill us with your presence and help us to do your will in Jesus Name.

title: HOPE IN CHRIST
passage: 17 “The poor and needy seek water, but there is none,Their tongues fail for thirst.I, the Lord, will hear them;I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them. 18 I will open rivers in desolate heights,And fountains in the midst of the valleys;I will make the wilderness a pool of water,And the dry land springs of water.19 I will plant in the wilderness the cedar and the acacia tree,The myrtle and the oil tree;I will set in the desert the cypress tree and the pineAnd the box tree together,20 That they may see and know,And consider and understand together,That the hand of the Lord has done this,And the Holy One of Israel has created it. (Isaiah 41:17-20)
content: What I enjoy most about our hope in Christ is the fact that we do not necessarily have to partake in the production of whatever we are expecting from God. We can just relax and trust God that has promised that He will do it. Now, it may not come in our own way or at our own time, we can be rest assured that it will come at the ‘right’ time and we will not be put to shame. Hopelessness sometimes develops from a condition that refuses to change. It creates a heart of unbelief, allowing you to doubt God, and causing you to wonder if He can deliver you from your present situation. Now, those unbelieving thoughts can develop into fear and fear can manifest into reality by bringing evil imaginations to life. Job says, “what I feared most has come upon me.” The most dangerous thing you can do when you are going through a diehard situation is to doubt God’s love for you or His ability to resolve your situation and save you from your problems. The Lord never rewards unbelief regardless of the cause. The best thing for you to do is to express your fear to the Lord and confess your willingness to trust in Him as your Father. Listen to the Word of God in the book of Isaiah, “who has declared from the beginning, that we may know?And former times, that we may say, ‘He is righteous’?Surely there is no one who shows,Surely there is no one who declares,Surely there is no one who hears your words.” (Isaiah 41:26) Think about it, if you do not trust Jesus, who else can you rely on and what else can you do to make the situation better?
application: I will go into worship and praise. I will worship God for who He is and his ability to do all things
memory-verse: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb: Even to your old age, I am He, And even to gray hairs I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you. (Isaiah 46:3-4)
prayer: Lord Jesus, help me to trust you, not just with some of my stuff but with all of my life.

title: UNEVEN HEART
passage: 5 Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding; 6 In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. 7 Do not be wise in your own eyes; Fear the LORD and depart from evil.8 It will be health to your flesh, And strength to your bones. (Proverbs 3:5-8)
content: When thinking of the gymnastic team on the beam during the Olympics, the gymnasts keep their eyes on the beam in their attempt to stabilize themselves.  Any distraction from looking at the beam can cause them to lose their balance, slip and fall. Anyone can be anxious. When I was teaching in an “alternative school,” there was a very nice and smart boy in my class. He is nice and able to focus in the class while on his medications. However, on the days he forgets to take his pills, he is visibly agitated, causing trouble, refusing to do his work and getting angry over everything. One day after his episode of anger, frustration, anxiety and bickering, I called his attention to his behavior. I wanted to understand his thoughts whenever he was angry and throwing temper tantrums. He told me that he had been in two foster homes within six months. Every time he was moved, his belongings got lost in the move. According to him, the thought of losing his belongings in school torments him. To make matters worse, his biological father promised to visit him and never came. This has diminished his trust level. He kept telling me that he does not trust anyone, and this makes him angry all the time. Well, in the school system, we are not supposed to preach the gospel to our students. So, what do you think I did? You guessed right. I asked him if it was okay to tell him about someone who could help him. In a very simple way, I introduced the Lord Jesus to him. I preached the Gospel of Jesus to him and He received Jesus as His Lord and Savior. He was determined to trust Jesus and because of this, I believe he was able to join a regular school later. Whenever fear grips the heart, we tend to lose focus. Fear causes anxiety which can lead to a loss in balance and subsequent failure. If anxiety is not properly handled, it may cause depression and other medical problems. Having faith in God is not the absence of fear but it is trusting and obeying God, in the midst of your fear.
application: I will keep speaking God’s promises to myself even when I’m afraid. I will repeat them loudly until I’m not afraid anymore. I will take a conscious step towards my goal despite my fears.
memory-verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. (Proverbs 3:5-6)
prayer: Lord, I put my trust in you in all my endeavors. Please help me not to lose focus in Jesus Name.

title: KILLER INSTINCT
passage: 32 Then David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him; your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.” 33 And Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.” 34 But David said to Saul, “Your servant used to keep his father’s sheep, and when a lion or a bear came and took a lamb out of the flock, 35 I went out after it and struck it, and delivered the lamb from its mouth; and when it arose against me, I caught it by its beard, and struck and killed it. 36 Your servant has killed both lion and bear; and this uncircumcised Philistine will be like one of them, seeing he has defied the armies of the living God.” 37 Moreover David said, “The LORD, who delivered me from the paw of the lion and from the paw of the bear, He will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.” And Saul said to David, “Go, and the LORD be with you!” (1 Samuel 17:32-37)
content: Sometimes, God gives you keen, tactical instincts. This means that He helps you to know the weapon of choice for different battles. This can also mean that he teaches you how to address different issues. Other times, He may fight your battles. In the story of David and Goliath, David remembered his past victories when he trusted God. King Saul wanted him to put on the king’s armor to the battle front when David wanted to fight Goliath. However, because David was not used to his armor or battle gear, he decided to use the ones he knew how to use. I think David would have lost the battle if he had fought with King Saul’s armor. Instead, David trusted in God with the weapon he had used with the bear and lion. I have seen circumstances where people relocated because their friends relocated, only to realize that this was not God’s plan for them. I have seen families fractured because of the loss of stability in the home from lack of spiritual support that could help the marriage. It is very dangerous to fashion your life after others. You should never allow peer pressure to cause you to move away from your destiny and calling from God.
application: Listen to the Holy Spirit first and always; He is your greatest Counselor and has placed His instinct in you so that you can discern His direction for your life.
memory-verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart And lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. (Proverbs 3:5-6)
prayer: Holy Spirit, I open up to you.  My eyes are on you for my next direction. Please lead me in Jesus Name.

title: RETROACTIVELY INVOLVED
passage: 28 Do not be a witness against your neighbor without cause, For would you deceive with your lips? 29 Do not say, “I will do to him just as he has done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.” (Proverbs 24:28-29)
content: A common and easy way to be happy after someone has been unkind to you is retaliation. You can either retaliate in the exact manner that you have been wronged or retaliate in a worse manner. The fact remains that the matter will linger longer than if you were to allow God to avenge your cause. When God avenges on your behalf, He goes beyond the areas that you envision to take revenge. He can avenge your case better that you can. Most of the time, God wants you to be still and “know that He is God.” When God fights your battle, He is not only doing it for you, but He may do it to change others so that in the end, He is glorified. However, when you take matters into your own hands, spreading rumors about the other party and slandering their name, you are not exhibiting Godly character. Don’t retaliate or destroy others when they offend you. Rise above the offense and offer forgiveness. People might pretend that the matter is settled, and all is forgiven. However, when the offender is found in error again and others are destroying the person’s character, they are quick to add fuel to the fire by sharing their unpleasant experiences with the person. Wait! If you do this, then there is still some animosity in your heart against the person and you might not have completely forgiven.
application: When someone offends you, do not look for a moment to retaliate, or in a sneaky way ask others to do it for you; instead forgive and let God be the “Commander-In-Chief” of your battle.
memory-verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart And lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. (Proverbs 3:5-6)
prayer: Lord, please forgive me for every slanderous word I have spoken against my neighbor. Help me to forgive and leave the judgment to you in Jesus Name.

title: FAMILY BUILDING BLOCK
passage: 3 Through wisdom a house is built, And by understanding it is established; 4 By knowledge the rooms are filled With all precious and pleasant riches. 5 A wise man is strong, Yes, a man of knowledge increases strength; (Proverbs 24:3-5)
content: I was at a youth event ten years ago when one of the youths was asked about her expectation of her parents and she replied, “quality time.” She explained that she gets everything she wants from her parents even when she asks for more, but she is lonely. The latest trendy things don’t fill her heart as much as quality time with her parents. She said that her parents sometimes allow her friends to visit and have sleepovers in her house, but it is not the same. All their generosity and the freedom given to her cannot be replaced with the quality time she wants from them. Both parents thought that quantity can replace quality time for their child. It is very important that we apply wisdom in our endeavors because in the family described earlier, the marriage did not last, and the child was not the same during and afterward the marriage ended. Striving for material wealth is acceptable, but not at the expense of your time with God and your family. There are some things that cannot be bought with money in life and we need wisdom and understanding to understand this. The quality time spent with your child and/or spouse cannot be purchased with any currency. Children grow fast, and time lost in their growing years may never be regained. Also, the time spent with your spouse will help to build your marriage and family. According to our Scripture for today, you need wisdom, knowledge and understanding to have a great house.
application: Make a conscious effort to spend time with your children and spouse. You don’t have to go out every time but spend quality time together.
memory-verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. (Proverbs 3:5-6)
prayer: Lord Jesus, I seek your wisdom, knowledge and understanding. Help me Lord to build my house for your Glory.

title: LEAN ON GOD
passage: 1Now it came to pass, in the days when the judges ruled, that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Bethlehem, Judah, went to dwell in the country of Moab, he and his wife and his two sons. 2 The name of the man was Elimelech, the name of his wife was Naomi, and the names of his two sons were Mahlon and Chilion—Ephrathites of Bethlehem, Judah. And they went to the country of Moab and remained there. 3 Then Elimelech, Naomi’s husband, died; and she was left, and her two sons. 4 Now they took wives of the women of Moab: the name of the one was Orpah, and the name of the other Ruth. And they dwelt there about ten years. 5 Then both Mahlon and Chilion also died; so the woman survived her two sons and her husband. (Ruth 1:1-5)
content: There is a staggering amount of people who work themselves into debt or sickness while trying to prove something to others. A lot of people are in this situation. I know someone who makes a six-figure salary, yet, complains that she has no money. She complains because she tries to show off her riches to those who knew her when she was poor. Also, she buys her children everything they request regardless of their need for them. She complains about lack and thinks the church is the reason for her lack. She was so stressed that she left the church. Amazingly, the church of God is marching on and her children sometimes come to the church programs without her knowledge. One can readily see it in their eyes that they are missing fellowship. If you leave your Rehoboth, a covering and “place of placement” because of offenses such as unmet expectations, unanswered prayers, etc., then your strength is small (Proverbs 24:10). Most times when you brave the challenges, stay put, and depend on God for provision and victory, you will be richly rewarded. God will never put you in a precarious position, though, He may test you. Know these two things. First, you are just going through and are not staying put. Second, it’s just a test.
application: You must trust that God will neither leave nor forsake you in your trial period. You must also hold on to His promises in His Word.
memory-verse: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, And lean not on your own understanding; In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths. (Proverbs 3:5-6)
prayer: O Lord in the Name of Jesus, give me the fortitude in adversity; so that I can remain immovable and unshakable in Jesus Name.

title: TRUST GOD ALONE
passage: 9 Then the chief butler told his dream to Joseph, and said to him, “Behold, in my dream a vine was before me, 10 and in the vine were three branches; it was as though it budded, its blossoms shot forth, and its clusters brought forth ripe grapes. 11 Then Pharaoh’s cup was in my hand; and I took the grapes and pressed them into Pharaoh’s cup, and placed the cup in Pharaoh’s hand.”12 And Joseph said to him, “This is the interpretation of it: The three branches are three days. 13 Now within three days Pharaoh will lift up your head and restore you to your place, and you will put Pharaoh’s cup in his hand according to the former manner, when you were his butler. 14 But remember me when it is well with you, and please show kindness to me; make mention of me to Pharaoh, and get me out of this house. 15 For indeed I was stolen away from the land of the Hebrews; and also I have done nothing here that they should put me into the dungeon.” (Genesis 40:9-15)
content: Before becoming the Prime Minister in Egypt, Joseph must have been very disappointed in humanity. First, his own brothers whom he lived with all his life, ate, and laughed together betrayed him. I know that if Joseph knew about his brothers’ malicious intent towards him, he would have avoided running the errand that his father sent him to check on his brothers. I know that Joseph would have disbelieved anyone who told him in advance that his brothers would put him in a pit and eventually, sell him to strangers. Secondly, after finding favor with God and his master Potiphar, I’m sure Joseph did not think that his master’s wife would consider having an affair with him. He could not have predicted her desperation. I’m also sure that he would not have expected his master to send him to prison because of the lies told against him. Thirdly, while in prison, he interpreted the dream of Pharaoh’s cupbearer. Joseph prophesied of his restoration and pleaded with him to remember Him. Joseph’s prophecy came to pass but the Cupbearer did not remember Joseph when he got to the palace before the King. The story of Joseph is a story that most people can understand. It is a story of betrayal by family and work acquaintances, slander, lies, divulged secrets, abandonment, and intrigue. Jesus Christ is the only true friend and Holy Spirit, the only true companion. Trust in Him completely today.
application: While it is okay to be good and nice to others; it is equally wrong to depend on them for your reward. Trust and depend on Christ alone.
