prayer: Lord. I want my walk with you to grow stronger every day. Take pride away from me, I want to live a humble life that is pleasing to you. Amen

title: KNOWING YOUR WORTH
passage: 10 Moses said to the Lord, “Pardon your servant, Lord. I have never been eloquent, neither in the past nor since you have spoken to your servant. I am slow of speech and tongue.” 11 The Lord said to him, “Who gave human beings their mouths? Who makes them deaf or mute? Who gives them sight or makes them blind? Is it not I, the Lord? 12 Now go; I will help you speak and will teach you what to say.” (Exodus 4:10-11)
content: Our human nature tends to make us put on a façade, causing us to show a perfectly put together picture of ourselves to the rest of the world. We are all tempted to hide our feelings of not feeling like we’re enough. It can be extremely tiring to keep up this façade, but I want you to know that because of Jesus Christ, you are enough, you are valuable. Ask yourself, is the way you view yourself based on how the world sees you or do you see yourself through the eyes of God according to His Word? Every time you feel like you’re not beautiful enough, you’re not successful enough, you’re not cool enough and etc., you’re basically contradicting the fact that you are fearfully and wonderfully made. Who are you to say that what God has created isn’t good or isn’t up to par? You can never forget that you were made in the image of God; He knew exactly what He was doing when He created you in your mother’s womb. The Bible has many examples of people who we would consider today as having low self-esteem. Moses is a great example.  When God came to him in the burning bush, Moses came up with so many excuses and questions before he finally admitted the cause of his fear and trepidation: “I have never been eloquent, neither in the past nor since you have spoken to your servant. I am slow of speech and tongue.” God didn’t respond by throwing compliments and telling Moses’ not to think of himself that way, He didn’t point out all of Moses’ positive attributes to get him to overlook the negative, like the world tends to do. Instead God points to Himself and says “Who gave human beings their mouths? Who makes them deaf or mute? Who gives them sight or makes them blind? Is it not I, the Lord?  Now go; I will help you speak and will teach you what to say.”  Remembering our worth comes from Christ can be an ongoing struggle but, the promise that God will be with us and help us should be all we need
application: Whenever the enemy tries to discourage you and bring up thoughts of self-doubt, remember that God made you and He has called everything He created good
memory-verse: Riches and honor come from you, and you are the ruler of everything. Power and might are in your hand, and it is in your hand to make great and to give strength to all. (1 Chronicles 29:12)
prayer: Thank you Lord for loving me and calling me your own. I pray that no matter where I go or what I do, You will help me to remember that you will always help me and teach me.

title: SURRENDERING CONTROL
passage: 5 Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding; 6 in all your ways acknowledge Him, and He shall direct your paths. (Proverbs 3:5-6)
content: This is a very popular verse and we as Christians love to quote it, but when we find ourselves struggling we tend to forget this particular scripture. God is telling us not to rely on our own understanding. We are supposed to let go and let God handle it. He knows exactly what He is doing, and as believers we should be able to trust Him no matter the situation. If God can resurrect Lazarus from death, He can do the same for your situation if just you let go and trust Him. When you’re used to being in control it can be quite hard to let some things go, but when you understand how much God cares about you, you will have no problem letting go because you know He’s more than capable. After you have surrendered your control to God and prayed, you can be at peace and know that everything will work out for your good. We may not fully comprehend what or why some things happen to us, but we can be confident that in some way, shape or form God is changing things in our favor. As Christians we are truly blessed. We pray to our Heavenly Father, and because He loves us He won’t withhold any good thing from us. Even if it doesn’t seem to be the case at the time we should just let go and let God.  Think back, aren’t there some situations or people that you’re glad God delivered you from, even though it hurt for some time? Trust that God sees past the present and is looking at the big picture of your life and knows what’s best for you.
application: Take some time to reflect on the areas of your life that you need to surrender to God’s control. Ask the Holy Spirit to help you lean on Him regarding those areas
memory-verse: Riches and honor come from you, and you are the ruler of everything. Power and might are in your hand, and it is in Your hand to make great and to give strength to all. (1 Chronicles 29:12)
prayer: Father help me to let go of things that are out of my control. Help me to trust in you at all times and have faith that you know what’s best for me.

title: GUILT-FREE SALVATION
passage: 16 For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life. 17 For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him. 18 Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe stands condemned already because they have not believed in the name of God’s one and only Son. (John 3: 16-18)
content: We all have sinned, and one of the products of sin is guilt. Feeling guilty for the sins we’ve committed isn’t necessarily bad, because it draws us closer to God by asking for forgiveness. When a person turns from sin and repents, their sin is immediately forgiven. Sometimes as believers it can be hard to get rid of the feeling of guilt, we know we’re saved but we still feel a lot of guilt from the choices we made in the past. The devil uses our guilt against us; he wants our guilt to stop us from growing in Christ. The good news is that God sent his Son to die for our sins and He will never condemn us for them. Our sins have been paid for in full on the Cross. Every sin we have and ever will commit has been covered by the grace of Christ Jesus. God wants us to be obedient and live righteously, but He doesn’t use guilt to get us to comply, He uses a loving hand, but that love requires discipline. Though sometimes we will suffer the consequence of our sins, God didn’t send His Son to earth to bring condemnation, He was sent to bring salvation to those who choose to believe in Him.
application: As soon as you repent from your sins God has forgiven and forgotten them, there’s no need to keep dwelling on the past and feeling guilty for your sins.
memory-verse: Riches and honor come from you, and you are the ruler of everything. Power and might are in your hand, and it is in your hand to make great and to give strength to all. (1 Chronicles 29:12)
prayer: Thank you Lord for sending your Son to die for me. Thank you for remembering my sins no more. Help me to move on and forgive myself just like you have forgiven me. Amen.

title: KNOW GOD AND STAY WITH HIM
passage: 8 But then, indeed, when you did not know God, you served those which by nature are not gods. 9 But now after you have known God, or rather are known by God, how is it that you turn again to the weak and beggarly elements, to which you desire again to be in bondage? (Galatians 4:8-9)
content: We can agree that God knows us, but how does one get to know God? This is something many people have been trying to understand for thousands of years. Has anybody ever seen God? Is it possible to really know Him? The scripture says in John 1:18 that, “No one has ever seen God, but the one and only Son, who is himself God and is in closest relationship with the Father, has made Him known.” Jesus Christ is our connection to the Father. The only way to truly know God is to know Christ. Jesus Christ is the One who holds the key. The life of Jesus is no secret, the world knows of His teachings, but the most important thing is to know of His death and resurrection. Understanding what took place on the Cross is essential to knowing the character of God. On the Cross, Christ endured the punishment that we deserved. God cared for us so much that He didn’t have to think twice about sacrificing Jesus Christ. On the Cross is also where God shows us that He wants us to accept Jesus, because that is the only way into Heaven. What was done on the Cross is also a display of the miraculous power of God, the power of resurrection, which is within us.  Once we have come to know God, we should not move away from Him. We are no longer slaves to the world and cannot afford to be trapped by the enemy. That same resurrection power is alive today. James 4:7 says, “Therefore submit to God. Resist the devil and he will flee from you.” The devil has no choice and has already been defeated. Once we know the goodness of God, there is no reason to be anywhere else.
application: As you get to know Christ more, don’t keep Him to yourself, share your knowledge of Him with others.
memory-verse: Riches and honor come from you, and you are the ruler of everything. Power and might are in your hand, and it is in your hand to make great and to give strength to all. (1 Chronicles 29:12)
prayer: Oh Lord, reveal yourself to me like never before. Strengthen me so that I may continuously resist the enemy.

title: GOD HEARS YOUR PRAYER
passage: 19 People of Zion, who live in Jerusalem, you will weep no more. How gracious he will be when you cry for help! As soon as he hears, he will answer you. (Isaiah 30:19)
content:
God always wants us to come to Him in prayer. God is a loving Father who wants to give us the things we ask for, if and when we need them. There are times that we pray and we do not get the answer right away or we do not get what we have asked for. We must understand that God knows exactly what is best for us and He answers us when we pray with the right motives. The Bible says, “You ask and do not receive, because you ask amiss, that you may spend it on your pleasures” (James 4:3). If you are praying for God to bless you with something, it is possible that this is one of the reasons your prayer is not being answered right away. The Bible also tells us that God answers the prayers of the people that trust in Him. (1 Chronicles 5:20) 
We must have faith and believe that God can and will answer our prayers. We are to trust in the Lord with all our hearts and lean not on our own understanding (Proverbs 3:5). It means we are to put everything in the Lord’s hands. When you sit down in a chair, you put all your weight on it because you have faith and trust that it will support you. We need to trust God in the same way. Prayer is how we develop and strengthen our relationship with God. If you never spend time or discuss anything with your biological father here on earth, what type of relationship will you have with him? So is our Father in Heaven. He wants us to spend personal time with Him. The more time we spend with God, the closer we are to Him, and the more we will see that God hears our prayers.
application: Pray with the mind of building up the Kingdom of God.
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in my name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Lord, direct my heart to go after the things You desire for my life

title: A HUMBLE PRAYER
passage: 12 Then he said to me, “Do not fear, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand, and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard; and I have come because of your words. (Daniel 10:12)
content:
When you ask someone to tell you something about Daniel, most will tell you that he’s the one who was thrown into a den of lions for serving God. Daniel was a servant of God and would not allow any man or any law to hinder that. Daniel’s intimate relationship with God was much more important to him than his well-being. Daniel was not worried about his safety and was not going to turn his back on God. Because of Daniel’s close relationship with God, he was very aware of what was going on in the spiritual realm. Daniel was able to clearly understand what God was saying to him through dreams and visions. Daniel was not only a man that could hear God, but he was a man that could pray. Through reading about Daniel’s prayer life, we can see that he understood this level of authority. 
In today’s Scripture, we see that Daniel’s prayer was answered because he humbled himself before God. When we become proud, we begin to think that we are operating in our own power. The truth is that we can’t do anything without the grace of God. When we humble ourselves before God, we acknowledge the fact that He is the One that gives us all power and authority. James 4:6 says, “But He gives more grace. Therefore He says: “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”
We need to understand that pride can be a hindrance to answers to our prayers. If there is an obstruction in our prayer life, there will be a problem in every other area of our lives. Humble yourself. Humility will help you unlock the door to open Heavens.
application: Recognize that God is your Source of power. Pray against the spirit of pride.
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in my name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Lord, help me to humble myself in the same way that Daniel did

title: SEEK GOD THROUGH PRAYER AND FASTING
passage: 3 Then I set my face toward the Lord God to make request by prayer and supplications, with fasting, sackcloth, and ashes. (Daniel 9:3)
content:
Even though Daniel lived in a dark and ungodly world that was filled with idolatry, he was still able to live a godly life. Because of the way Daniel sought after the Lord, the favor of God was upon him. The Bible tells us in Daniel 6, that three times a day, Daniel would pray to God. Daniel not only prayed, but he denied himself by fasting. Daniel was a faithful and obedient servant, who continuously sought the face of God. 
Jesus said that we should seek after the Kingdom of God and His righteousness. We are not supposed to just sit back, put our feet up, and allow things to happen to us. We are to take action and go after God. Seeking after God means that we set our hearts and our minds on Him and the things of His Kingdom. This is something that can be done through prayer and fasting. When we faithfully seek after God, we will find Him. When we find God, He will bless and reward us - the same way He did for Daniel.  Through that type of connection with the Father, anything is possible. It does not matter what type of miracle we need from God, He can do it. The Bible says, “But without faith it is impossible to please Him, for he who comes to God must believe that He is, and that He is a rewarder of those who diligently seek Him.” (Hebrews 11:6)
The greatest reward lies in knowing God the Father, Jesus Christ the Son, and the Holy Spirit. When we have that reward, we have everything.
application: Continue to seek the face of the Lord through prayer and fasting
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in my name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Lord, give me the desire to continuously seek You.

title: A PRAYER FOR DELIVERANCE
passage: I waited patiently for the LORD; and He inclined to me, and heard my cry. 2 He also brought me up out of a horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and established my steps. 3 He has put a new song in my mouth— Praise to our God; many will see it and fear, and will trust in the LORD. (Psalm 40:1-3)
content:
Christ came into the world as a deliverer to rescue us from the dark pit of sinfulness. Many times when we need deliverance, we are not as patient as we should be. When we are going through hard times, it is normal for us to pray and ask God to do what we want and when we want it. When there is a crucial need in our lives, it can seem as if God does not hear us. We cannot treat God like a pizza delivery man and our prayers like the order. Something we need to know about Satan is that he will do whatever he can to make things impossible for us. It is the enemy’s plan for Christians to lose faith in God, but we must never give up. With Christ, we have more than enough to overcome any opposition. He is always for us, not against us. 
In Romans 8:31-39, Paul wrote about how those who are in Christ are more than conquerors. Jesus Christ did not only die for us, He is also interceding for us. This is illustrated in this passage in Romans, “If God is for us, who can be against us?” (Romans 8:31). It doesn’t matter what type of opposition we face, or what type of pit we find ourselves in, because of the love of God, there is always a way out. Nothing will ever be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ. Christ is our Deliverer, but we must be patient. Our prayers will be answered according to God’s will for our lives. The hand of God will deliver us once and for all, we will be lifted out of the pit, and our feet shall be placed on solid ground.
application: Extend a hand to someone who might be in some type of pit or is hurting. Pray for them.
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in my name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Lord, pull me out of any pit of sin. Heal my body of any pain or affliction.

title: WE NEED THE RIGHT PERSPECTIVE
passage: Seek the LORD while He may be found, call upon Him while He is near. 7 Let the wicked forsake his way, and the unrighteous man his thoughts; let him return to the LORD, and He will have mercy on him; and to our God, for He will abundantly pardon. 8 “For My thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways My ways,” says the LORD. 9 “For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are My ways higher than your ways, and My thoughts than your thoughts.  (Isaiah 55:6-9)
content:
One of the most important things to know as children of God is His will for our lives. We know that if we seek after God, we will find Him. Finding God is important because we need God to direct our paths. If we are not close to God, how will He show us the correct route to take in life? 
When it comes to knowing God’s will, there is the reality that whatever it is we want for ourselves may not be what God wants for us. We do not think or reason like God, therefore we cannot naturally see beyond what is here and now. We can’t even be 100% sure about what will happen a few minutes from now, unlike our Father in Heaven. We need to have the right perspective. Many times we don’t see ourselves and the people surrounding us the way God wants us to. Instead of focusing on the things we want for ourselves, we should try to focus on what is best for the Kingdom of God. Instead of always praying for what we want, we should try praying for God’s will concerning His Kingdom. 
It is all about having the right perspective. God’s vision is perfect. God can see everything that is going on in our lives, in our homes, in the church, and the rest of the world. God, who is the Alpha and Omega, can see everything past, present and future at all times. Also, because He is a good God, the path He has for us is always the best path.
application: Ask the Spirit of God to lead you to pray with the right perspective.
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in my name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Lord, I want Your will to be done concerning my life. Make my heart a clean slate and direct my paths.

title: GLORIFY GOD IN PRAYER
passage: 27 “Now My soul is troubled, and what shall I say? ‘Father, save Me from this hour’? But for this purpose I came to this hour. 28 Father, glorify Your name.” Then a voice came from heaven, saying, “I have both glorified it and will glorify it again.” (John 12:27-28)
content:
Jesus always knew His purpose here on earth. The main focus in the mind of Jesus was glorifying His Father. This should teach us that when times are hard, we cannot forget to praise and glorify God through prayer. 
We must glorify God not only through prayer, but also in how we act, how we think, and how we treat others. To glorify God means to lift Him up and bring Him honor. We have to recognize how amazing God is before anything else. We can glorify God with our time. We can glorify God with our faith. There are many ways to glorify Him. We were all created for the glory of God, and Jesus knew that. "Everyone who is called by My name, whom I have created for My glory; I have formed him, yes, I have made him." (Isaiah 43:7).
We were all created for God's glory. It doesn't matter who you are or where you are, you were created for the glory of God. One of the ways we can glorify God is by telling others about His goodness. We are instruments that God wants to use and we should allow Him to do so. Simply obeying the instructions we have received from God is another way of glorifying Him. Let your life glorify God in all that you do
application: Take yourself out of the daily routine of prayer. Push your needs to the side and spend extra time honoring God for who He is.
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in my name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in my name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Lord, I give You all the glory. Father, I acknowledge that you are a good God and I give You all the praise.

title: GOD WILL ANSWER
passage: Then Jonah prayed to the LORD his God from the fish’s belly. 2 And he said: “I cried out to the LORD because of my affliction, and He answered me. “Out of the belly of Sheol I cried, and You heard my voice. (Jonah 2:1-2)
content:
My mother always said to me that God only helps the people that help themselves. That reminds me of what the Scripture says about faith without works being dead. We can have a great amount of faith and believe that God is going to do something for us, but there has to be an action behind that faith. I can pray as much as I want about doing well on a big exam, but if I don’t help myself by studying and reviewing the material for the exam, I probably will not do too well. Many times when we have already performed poorly, that is when we want God to help us. We need to obey God before He allows us to be swallowed by a big fish, just like Jonah.
Jonah is like the student who puts themselves in a bad situation by not studying or listening to the given instructions. When Jonah found himself in trouble, he called on God for help. If he had just done what God had told him to do initially, he wouldn’t have been swallowed by the fish. Like Jonah, we serve a God that will answer our prayers no matter how bad things have gotten for us. It doesn’t matter how bad we have messed up or how angry we think God is, He is always waiting on us to speak to Him. Unlike the relationships we have with human beings, God is always there for us. He will never tell us that it’s a bad time and to call Him back, God is always there. He might not give us the answer that we are looking for, but He always has the best answer for us.
application: Be obedient when following the instructions God has given you.
memory-verse: “And whatever you ask in My name, that I will do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. If you ask anything in My name, I will do it. (John 14:13-14)
prayer: Father, thank you for always being there for me. Thank you for answering my prayers.

title: BECAUSE HE LIVES, I CAN FACE TOMORROW
passage: 22A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, but the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous (Proverbs 13:22 )
content: We wish all the fathers a Happy Fathers’ Day. We thank you for all that you do and the sacrifices that you make for your families. I want to specially thank the Father of all fathers, our heavenly Father, for being there for us and never leaving us nor forsaking us throughout this journey of life. It is a special privilege to be His child and not to be taken for granted. It was love that made God, the Father, to sacrifice His only son in order to reconcile you and I to Himself so that we would not be lost forever to Him in eternity. What a great daddy! Earthly fathers strive to leave good legacies for their children. Some fathers leave great fortune, riches, good name, Ivy League education, wisdom, good genes, etc. in order to secure the future generation. While these are worthy things that improve quality of life, they don’t save lives. It will not secure eternity for their children. God, our heavenly father, our example, thought ahead of time. He did not only think of now but the future. He reconciled us to Himself through Jesus, the Son, the mediator of the new covenant. After the reconciliation, he gave us His spirit, the Holy Spirit, to journey with us through life and finally, He secured our eternity where we will live with Him forever. What a good Daddy! He thought of everything. He did not leave anything to chance where we are concerned. As fathers, our heavenly Father is the one to emulate. Regardless of how our own parents have lived, we have the obligation to teach our children the way of God. We can work hard and leave worldly fortunes and inheritance for the next generation as the bible advises in the book of Proverbs that a good man leaves inheritance for his childrens’ children.  However, we should not forget the most important inheritance, a relationship with God, our Maker. This is a legacy worth leaving behind because it transcends this life and is a gift that we can leave for our childrens’ children. Wealth and fortunes can be squandered, good names dragged through the mud with bad behavior, but a relationship with God is personal and will change any future for the better if given. Strive to teach your children about their heavenly Father today. Take the time to train your children in the way of God. Let them grow in their relationship with God under your guidance and example. It will change the course of your family and impact future generations.
application: Commit to leaving a legacy of faith for the next generation.
memory-verse: “LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, enable me to leave a legacy of following Christ for my children and generations to come.

title: A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE
passage: 14 For this reason I bow my knees to the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,[c] 15 from whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named, 16 that He would grant you, according to the riches of His glory, to be strengthened with might through His Spirit in the inner man, 17 that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; that you, being rooted and grounded in love, 18 may be able to comprehend with all the saints what is the width and length and depth and height— 19 to know the love of Christ which passes knowledge; that you may be filled with all the fullness of God  (Ephesians 3: 14-19 ).
content: As human beings in this current age, we want the best, fastest, latest, and current things. One example is electronical gadgets. I might not buy the latest version but I don’t want it to be too dated because I know in a few months to years, there will be another more updated version. The bible in the book of Proverbs says that as a man thinks in his heart so is He. If we have this thought process in our secular life, it is very likely that we apply it to our spiritual life as well. Most people think that the Christian God is an outdated God who has rigid rules and regulations. Others see God as a task master from yesteryears who is not “current” and does not understand the challenges of living in this day and age. We want to fit God in a box. We forget that God created the universe and everything in it. He knows the beginning and the end of all things. He was there in the beginning through the creation of man in the garden of Eden. He understands evolution even better than us. For example, He was there from the days of camels to horse-drawn buggies to automobiles to planes to space shuttles, etc. He knows how everything starts and how it will end. God is bigger and better than our understanding of Him. He is bigger than the biggest, stronger than the strongest, wiser than the wisest of men. Let us pray that God will open our eyes to see Him as He truly is; the Almighty, Omnipotent, Omnipresent, Only Wise, All Sufficient, and Totally Capable God. When Peter, James and John saw Jesus transformed in their eyes on the Mount of Transfiguration, Peter said, “Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters – one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.” While he was still speaking, they heard a voice from the cloud that said, “This is my son, whom I love; with Him I am well pleased. Listen to him!” I believe after that encounter they saw Jesus differently. If we will see Him as He truly is, it will strengthen our faith. It will change our view of life completely. If God will open our eyes to see Him in His glory, we can go out and debunk myths that keep other people from accepting Christ. Sometimes, it is our portrayal of God that stops other people from accepting Christ. Pray that God will help you to represent Him well to the world in a way that men would be drawn to Him instead of repelled by Him.
application: I will be careful in how I carry myself and act with others. I will lead others to God instead of away from Him
memory-verse: “LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, help me to be a good ambassador of Christ everywhere I go. Draw men to yourself through my life and testimony of you.

title: GOD OF ALL FLESH
passage: 19 Now the LORD God had formed out of the ground all the wild animals and all the birds in the sky. He brought them to the man to see what he would name them; and whatever the man called each living creature, that was its name. 20 So the man gave names to all the livestock, the birds in the sky and all the wild animals (Genesis 2:19).
content: As human beings made in God’s image, we are tempted to exalt ourselves over everything. Indeed, man is superior to other animals because God gave man authority over them but God is superior over man still. Sometimes because of our challenges, we assume that God has lost control. Other times because of our position, we act like we don’t need God and have everything in our control. We try to exert the same authority God gave us over the earth over God Himself, our creator. The truth is that we have no control, authority and power of our own except that which God has given to us. I remember hearing stories of people that get upset because God has not yet performed their miracle and backslide. They say that they don’t want to serve God anymore. It is very flattering to think God needs us but the truth of the matter is that we need God more. We are created for His glory alone. Everything God does is centered on this notion. Perhaps you have just received your blessing, you still need God to maintain it. If you are still waiting for your blessing, you need God to provide it. Pray that you will not leave God for any reason because apart from Him, you can do nothing. In the book of John 15, Jesus said, “I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.  If you do not remain in me, you are like a branch that is thrown away and withers; such branches are picked up, thrown into the fire and burned.” We need Jesus, our vine, to grow. Without Him, we would not flourish like God originally intended. Connect to God always. Don’t disconnect from your source.
application: I will not take credit for my existence and successes. I will give the glory back to God because apart from Him, I can accomplish nothing!
memory-verse: LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, help me to see you as my source. Help me not to disconnect from my source as I go through life. I need you to help me to fulfill my destiny and life’s purpose.

title: RELIABLE
passage: 1 The hand of the LORD came upon me and brought me out in the Spirit of the LORD, and set me down in the midst of the valley; and it was full of bones. 2 Then He caused me to pass by them all around, and behold, there were very many in the open valley; and indeed they were very dry. 3 And He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” So I answered, “O Lord GOD, You know.” 4 Again He said to me, “Prophesy to these bones, and say to them, ‘O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD! 5 Thus says the Lord GOD to these bones: “Surely I will cause breath to enter into you, and you shall live. 6 I will put sinews on you and bring flesh upon you, cover you with skin and put breath in you; and you shall live. Then you shall know that I am the LORD.”’”(Ezekiel 37:1-6)
content: A  song by Shekinah Glory Ministry says, “Here is my heart, I give it Lord to You; Here is my life, I lay it before You; Where else would I go? What else would I do? If I did not know You? How deeply I need You, my Lord; Like the desert needs the rain, I need You; Like the ocean needs the streams, I need You; Like the morning needs the sun, I need You; Lord You are my only one”. This song confirms everything I believe about God. I need God because I am incomplete without Him. I cannot run my own life and be all that I am supposed to be outside of Him. Is it possible to be rich, successful and famous without God? Yes but there is a higher calling than wealth and riches. I want to fulfill the purpose for which I was created. Today, resolve in your mind that the answer to all of your life’s challenges is in God. The bible says that He is God who knows the beginning to the end. David astutely said in the book of Psalms 139 when he said about God,” You watched me as I was being formed in utter seclusion, as I was woven together in the dark of the womb.  You saw me before I was born. Every day of my life was recorded in your book. Every moment was laid out before a single day had passed.” The same is true for us. No one can make this claim, not parents, other gods, friends, therapist, psychologist, etc. God can put people in my life to help me in different situations but ultimately I know that it is God using them to help me. Lord, help me to continue to rely on You totally. To rely on God is not a sign of weakness because no one can exist alone. God knows how to orchestrate your life so that everything works together for good. I urge you to rely on Him today. He is a reliable and dependable God.
application: I will rely on God today and stop relying on my strength or the strength of others alone.
memory-verse: “LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, I cannot help myself. I depend on you. Do not let me be ashamed in Jesus name.

title: PRAISE WORTHY
passage: 9 I will not take a bull from your house, Nor goats out of your folds. 10 For every beast of the forest is Mine, And the cattle on a thousand hills.11 I know all the birds of the mountains, And the wild beasts of the field are Mine.12 “If I were hungry, I would not tell you; For the world is Mine, and all its fullness.13 Will I eat the flesh of bulls, Or drink the blood of goats?14 Offer to God thanksgiving, And pay your vows to the Most High.15 Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you shall glorify Me.”  (Psalm 50:9-15 )
content: God is worthy of all our praise. He desires and deserves it.  I know you are asking yourself, “why should I praise Him when He hasn’t done anything for me lately?” The purpose of man’s creation was to give God glory and praise. The book of Revelation talks about God, sitting on a throne with twenty four thrones surrounding His throne. On these thrones sat twenty-four elders with crowns of gold on their heads yet they fall down before God and worship Him by laying their crowns before the throne and saying, “You are worthy, our Lord and God,  to receive glory and honor and power, for you created all things, and by your will they were created and have their being.” If elders with gold crowns are worshipping God in Heaven, who is man that He cannot bow to His maker? I want to point out that the elders were not worshipping God for the things He has done for them but for who He is. We can learn a lesson from this example. It is easy to worship God when He does good things for us. However, whether He does good things for us or not doesn’t diminish His worth. He is God in the good and bad times. He is in control even when things seem out of control. As such, we should reverence Him and give Him His due because that is what He wants from us. He cannot eat food, drink, spend our money but our praise He can take for Himself. There is a saying about when praises go up, blessings come down. This is true. King Solomon sacrificed 1000 burnt offerings to God at Gibeon. This prompted God to ask him in a dream, “Ask for whatever you want me to give you.” Not only did God give him his request, God added extra blessings because He moved God in his worship. Move God with your “reckless” praise today. Praise Him not only for what He has done but praise Him especially for who He is. He will never share His glory with any man. Let your praises go up and receive the blessing of God for you and your family.
application: I will praise God for who He is and not only for His blessings.
memory-verse: “LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, I praise you for you alone are worthy of all my praise and worship. Forgive me for withholding my praises till you bless me.

title: THE ULTIMATE
passage: 1I lift up my eyes to the mountains—where does my help come from? 2 My help comes from the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth. 3He will not let your foot slip—he who watches over you will not slumber; 4 indeed, he who watches over Israel will neither slumber nor sleep. 5 The LORD watches over you—the LORD is your shade at your right hand; the sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night. 7 The LORD will keep you from all harm—he will watch over your life; the LORD will watch over your coming and going both now and forevermore. (Psalm 121:1-2)
content: I remember hearing about a woman waiting on the Lord for a baby. After many years of faithfully waiting, she got tired. After all, hope deferred makes the heart sick. At a point, she was introduced to a witch doctor where she went to seek for “counsel” regarding the cause of the delay. She only wanted to know the cause of the delay but one thing led to another and she ended up having a baby with the witch doctor and leaving her marital home. It was a sad story because she was faithful initially. Her reason for going to the witch doctor was not to seek for a child, but to understand the cause of her delay in having children. All along, she had good intentions. The truth is that “every apple from the devil is full of worms though it looks juicy on the outside.” Any solution that we seek outside of God, whether through soothsayers, psychics, fortune tellers, diviner, oracle, etc. will have consequences because they are not our maker or creator. Some of the powers they consult cannot be found in God. No one goes to the inventor of a food blender to ask how to fix a problem with a Mercedes–Benz truck. Though, there is engineering involved in the manufacturing of both things, each inventor and manufacturer is an expert in their own area. God is the creator of our lives. He is the one that holds the patent to our lives and understand our design. Seek your solutions for problems in God. The bible is the ultimate answer to our problem. Seek biblical solution. There is nothing new under the sun. As you study the word of God, God can give you understanding of the problem Himself, He can direct you to people, or He can direct people your way. The one thing you can count on is that He will lead you. He might not answer in the way you think He should but He will listen, only be ready to follow His leading all the way and you will be successful.
application: I will not seek solution outside of God for my life challenges. I will wait on God even if it is difficult.
memory-verse: “LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, as I wait on you, let me experience you in a new dimension. Use my life to showcase your glory in the miracles that will come my way in Jesus name.

title: THE RAT RACE
passage: 10 Not only that, but Rebekah’s children were conceived at the same time by our father Isaac. 11 Yet, before the twins were born or had done anything good or bad—in order that God’s purpose in election might stand: 12 not by works but by him who calls—she was told, “The older will serve the younger. 13 Just as it is written: “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”14 What then shall we say? Is God unjust? Not at all! 15 For he says to Moses,“I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”16 It does not, therefore, depend on human desire or effort, but on God’s mercy.  (Romans 9:10-16 )
content: I have learned a lot from reading the book of Ecclesiastes in the bible. I was thought since childhood that if you study and work hard, you will automatically be successful. The place of God in our life is not well enunciated in my childish mind. However, in Chapter 9 of Ecclesiastes, King Solomon, a wealthy and wise king, wrote about time and seasons. He says that the race is not to the swift nor the battle to the strong, nor does food come to the wise or wealth to the brilliant or favor to the learned; but time and chance happen to them all. In this day and age, this is a contrary way of thinking. At first, one might relegate this thought process to “old testament” thinking. However, a similar quote is seen in the new testament in the book of Romans Chapter 9. It talks about God’s conversation with Moses when He said He will have mercy and compassion on whom He chooses. If this is the case, regardless of the appearance, we don’t really do anything on our own. If our plans work out “without God,” it is only because He is merciful to us. It is not because we are wiser, privileged, smarter, charismatic, etc. If we look back at our lives, some people are better than we are and yet, they are not where we are. We forget that we have because He gives! Perhaps we are in a place where all our plans have not come to fruition yet. It is possible that we might have forgotten to include God in these plans. Go back and include God. Ask Him to help you to make your plans succeed if it is His will for you. If it is not His will, ask Him to lead you into His will. You will be happier being in His will than in your own plan outside of His will. Man has many plans but unless God approves those plans, they will not be executed. Invite God into your plans today.
application: Apart from You, I can do nothing. I recognize this truth and invite You into all my plans today.
memory-verse: “LORD, you alone are my portion and my cup; you make my lot secure.  The boundary lines have fallen for me in pleasant places; surely I have a delightful inheritance. I will praise the LORD, who counsels me; even at night my heart instructs me. I keep my eyes always on the LORD. With him at my right hand, I will not be shaken” (Psalm 16:5-8)
prayer: Lord, you are my source. I pray that I will always be in your Will in Jesus name.

title: REMAIN IN CHRIST
passage: 5 “I am the vine; you are the branches. If you remain in me and I in you, you will bear much fruit; apart from me you can do nothing.  (John 15:5)
content: In our Bible reading for today, Jesus describes Himself as the vine and us as the branches. The branch grows out of the vine and the vine holds the branches and supplies it with nutrients. The vine basically keeps the branch alive. The branch cannot survive if it falls off from the vine. As children of Jesus Christ, we need to remain in Him to thrive. Jesus knew from the foundation of the world that some of His children, whom He saved and who love Him, might come to a point in their walk with Him where they feel like giving up or feel weakened by the situations they face. But He said “remain in Me.” How do we remain in Christ? We remain in Christ by making a conscious decision every day to live out our relationship with Him. We need to make a new commitment to Him every day. In the same way that couples tell each other that they love each other, Christ wants to hear it from us too. He wants us to show that we love Him by the way we live our lives every day. We remain in Christ when His Word remains in us and we obey His commandments. Many Christians today do not understand or refuse to accept the fact that there are commandments that our Lord has given us that we must follow. Yes, we have grace, but we must also do what He says if we want to abide in Him. I urge you to remain in Christ and not let the devil take you off course. Do not get tired or too familiar with your love towards Christ. Renew your commitment and love to Him every day.
application: Ask God to keep you in your daily walk with Him.
memory-verse: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to remain in you and in doing so, become more like you.

title: FRUITFULNESS
passage: 12 The righteous will flourish like a palm tree, they will grow like a cedar of Lebanon; 13 planted in the house of the Lord, they will flourish in the courts of our God. 14 They will still bear fruit in old age, they will stay fresh and green, 15 proclaiming, “The Lord is upright; he is my Rock, and there is no wickedness in him.” (Psalm 92:12-15)
content: As long as a prince remains in the palace or in His father’s territory, he enjoys the benefits of royalty. The moment he ventures into some other kingdom, without the royal backing, he no longer enjoys the benefits of royalty. When we remain in Christ, He helps us bear fruit. Bearing fruit as a Christian means that we develop the characteristics of Jesus. Just as a branch cannot produce fruits when it is cut off from a tree, we cannot bear fruit when we are no longer in Christ. The fruits, or the characteristics of the Holy Spirit, are love, joy, peace, forbearance, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control (Galatians 5:22-23). Look at the world around us today. How many people can possess all of these traits on a consistent basis without a relationship with Christ? In fact, the world is daily and increasingly showing fruits that are opposite of these. People hardly love anymore, they chase happiness like its fleeting, they do not forgive and self-control is the hardest thing. As Christ rightly said, “neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me.” You can only continue to bear fruit, or possess the aforementioned attributes, when you remain in Christ. When He dwells in you and you have a genuine connection to Him, the fruits naturally come to life. People around you can see and testify to them. You don’t force them, they just grow from within you. Do you have Christ in you? Are you remaining in Him? Do you read and listen to His Word? Do you practice them and obey His commands? Make strides to develop characteristics of Jesus.
application: Ask for the fruits of the Spirit in prayer. Be sure to remain in Him.
memory-verse: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Lord, help me to remain in you so that I may bear fruit.

title: THE MASTER GARDENER
passage: “I am the true vine; my Father is the gardener. He cuts off every branch of mine that does not produce fruit. And he trims and cleans every branch that produces fruit so that it will produce even more fruit.” (John 15:1-2)
content: Jesus Christ was talking to His children in today’s Bible reading. He informed us that God (the Father) is the Gardener (the one that takes care of the tree). When we, the branches, bear fruit like we are supposed to, God cleans and prunes our lives. He takes away every hindrance that would potentially keep us from growing. He gives us the ability to fulfill our purpose. But all of this can only be possible when we know Jesus Christ in the first place, and remain in Him. Do you have a personal relationship with Jesus? Can you confidently say to yourself “I am His child and He is my Father”? Are you still in Him and do you continue to see the evidence of a relationship with Him in your life? God is willing to make your life beautiful. He wants you to bear fruits and He wants to make it easier for you to fulfill your purpose. Resolve to develop and renew your relationship with Him today. The rewards are immense.
application: Be more purposeful about displaying the fruits of the Spirit. After you have prayed for them, start to practice them.
memory-verse: Remain in me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Lord, please clean up my life and make my life beautiful for your glory.

title: DEAD BRANCHES
passage: “If any do not remain in me, they are like a branch that is thrown away and then dies. People pick up dead branches, throw them into the fire, and burn them.” (John 15:6)
content: In our reading today, Jesus explained that branches that do not remain on the tree will dry up and fall to the ground. When a branch is on the ground, it’s only natural for someone to pick it up and put it in the trash or burn it. The same thing happens to any child of God who does not remain in Christ. God promised us total security as long as we are His children. But we can only be assured of this total security as long as we truly remain in Him. The moment we drift off or no longer abide, we become open to all kinds of evil. The Bible informs us that the devil (our enemy) goes around looking to find any stray sheep that he may feast on. It is unwise to stray away from our Shepherd. In the same vein, it is not very smart to get used to or bored with Him, because then our relationship with Him is put in danger. The devil is always looking to catch us at our weakest times when we haven’t been praying or studying God’s Word like we should, when we haven’t been fellowshipping with like-minded believers like we ought to, or when we just stop paying as much attention to God like we used to. Those are times of great danger. Be on guard. Make sure you are conscious of your relationship with Jesus Christ. Pay attention to it and nurture it. Examine your life to see if you truly are bearing Christ-like fruits and stay connected to Him. Only when you make sure of these things can you be sure of total security.
application: Make sure of your standing in Christ every day.
memory-verse: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Lord, help me to remain in you and keep me from the evil one.

title: A BLANK CHECK
passage: “If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.” (John 15:7)
content: Who turns down a blank check? Imagine if the President of the Untied States visited you and asked you to make any request and you would have what you asked for. Our Heavenly Father who possesses all riches in glory, the One who created the Heavens and the earth, has given us a blank check. In our reading today, He said “ask whatever you wish”. He didn’t say ask for what you think I can do for you. He said whatever you wish, and it will be done for you. But there is a clause. You have to remain in Him and ask according to His will. The Bible is full of promises of God to bless those who obey Him. If you are not His child and are not in Him, He is not obligated to answer your prayers. He doesn’t owe you anything. However, if you are His child and remain in Him, He is obligated to answer your prayers because He has promised to do so in His Word. The Lord says He honors His Word more than His Name. He is the One that does what He says and you can take His Word to the bank. If you haven’t at any time given your life to Christ, now is the accepted time. Ask Him to come into your life. Yield your heart to Him. If you are already His child, rededicate yourself to Him. Examine your life to see if you are indeed in Him. Ask for His help to remain in Him. He is the only One that can help you to remain in Him. Don’t forget, you have a blank check, use it.
application: Fulfill your part of the deal. Remain in Christ, and you will have unlimited blank checks
memory-verse: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Lord, help me to remain in you. I want to enjoy the blessings of abiding in You..

title: IF YOU LOVE ME, DO WHAT I COMMAND
passage: “Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.  You are my friends if you do what I command.  I no longer call you servants, because a servant does not know his master’s business. Instead, I have called you friends, for everything that I learned from my Father I have made known to you.” (John 15:13-15)
content: There is a song that goes like this: I am a friend of God, I am a friend of God, I am a friend of God; He calls me friend. Who does God call His friends? In Matthew 7:21-24, Jesus Christ said  “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the Kingdom of Heaven, but only the one who does the will of my Father who is in Heaven. Many will say to me on that day, ‘Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name and in your name drive out demons and in your name perform many miracles?’ Then I will tell them plainly, ‘I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers!’ Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock.” This verse illustrates to us that we are only considered His friend if we put what He says into practice. It’s nice to be called a Christian and go to church regularly, always be around people of God, and to maybe even sing in the choir, but if you do not do what God says and obey His commands, you are an alien to Him. Not knowing God’s commands or words is not an excuse for not doing them. As they say, ignorance is not an excuse before the law. That’s why God gave us His Word in the Bible. We need to read it for ourselves and find out all that God commands us to do, and then do it. Jesus Christ calls us to Himself and is interested in everyone being saved, but He also wants those whom He has called to obey His commands. That is the only way we can remain in Him. When we don’t, it becomes disobedience. Resolve to study God’s Word and obey His commands today and for the rest of this year. Therein lays the secret to being His friend.
application: Obey God in everything He commands. That’s how you show Him you love Him.
memory-verse: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Lord, let me be your friend indeed. I want my life to show others that I know You and I am your friend.

title: YOU NEED HIS HELP
passage: “I am coming to you now. But I pray these things while I am still in the world so that these followers can have all of my joy in them.  I have given them your teaching. And the world has hated them, because they don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world. I am not asking you to take them out of the world but to keep them safe from the Evil One. They don’t belong to the world, just as I don’t belong to the world. (John 17:13-15)
content: Like Jesus Christ prayed in our reading today, we need to continue to pray for God to keep us safe from the evil one. Many people visualize the evil one as a dark monster with horns on his head. On the contrary, the evil one is all and anything that seeks to take you away from Jesus Christ. He may come to you in the most subtle and pleasant way possible. He may even come to you through a family member or your job. The evil one is very crafty and a lot wiser than we are. He has been here longer than we have. He knows all the possible ways to take us away from Christ. We need to continue to ask for help from God. “God is strong and can help you not to fall. He can bring you before his glory without any wrong in you and can give you great joy” (Jude 1:24). It is only by His help that we can stay safe in this world. Safe from distractions of the world, safe from the evils in the world, and safe from the corrupting influence of the world. Remember, your enemy the devil prowls around like a roaring lion looking for someone to devour. Pray without ceasing.
application: Pray without ceasing and put on the full armor of God in order to withstand the schemes of the enemy.
memory-verse: Remain in Me, as I also remain in you. No branch can bear fruit by itself; it must remain in the vine. Neither can you bear fruit unless you remain in Me. (John 15:4)
prayer: Lord, give me the grace to resist the enemy. I need your help.
